channel.title: Seen/Saw Podcast
channel.description: Musician Logan Sorese is terrified of the infinite facelessness of the internet, so in order to face his fear, he's releasing a song weekly (sometimes bi-weekly) during 2018.
channel.itunes:summary: Musician Logan Sorese is terrified of the infinite facelessness of the internet, so in order to face his fear, he's releasing a song weekly (sometimes bi-weekly) during 2018.
channel.itunes:author: Logan Sorese
channel.itunes:subtitle: A weekly music podcast from Logan Sorese

item.title: Hold Your Breath
item.description: Sometimes you make a song and you think it’s about one thing until you play it for a crowd. Earlier this week, I played this song at my weekly open mic and I got an emotional reaction from someone I admire greatly. Someone who treats art with the utmost respect...
item.content:encoded:
Sometimes you make a song and you think it’s about one thing until you play it for a crowd. Earlier this week, I played this song at my weekly open mic and I got an emotional reaction from someone I admire greatly. Someone who treats art with the utmost respect and I love them so dearly and I aspire to be more like them. So, this song goes out to that person; you know who you are.
This song has piano, which is new for me. In general, I’m not good at it, but I can keep time and make things happen if I figure out chords and go from there.
item.itunes:subtitle: Sometimes you make a song and you think it’s about one thing until you play it for a crowd. Earlier this week, I played this song at my weekly open mic and I got an emotional reaction from someone I admire greatly. Someone who treats art with the utmost respect...
item.itunes:summary:
Sometimes you make a song and you think it’s about one thing until you play it for a crowd. Earlier this week, I played this song at my weekly open mic and I got an emotional reaction from someone I admire greatly. Someone who treats art with the utmost respect and I love them so dearly and I aspire to be more like them. So, this song goes out to that person; you know who you are.
This song has piano, which is new for me. In general, I’m not good at it, but I can keep time and make things happen if I figure out chords and go from there.
item.itunes:author: Logan Sorese

item.title: Shapeshifter
item.description: This is the first public week of Seen/Saw so thanks to all the listeners tuning in for the first time! This is a track I wrote and recorded in Detroit with Jon Marsh on Drums.
item.content:encoded: This is the first public week of Seen/Saw so thanks to all the listeners tuning in for the first time! This is a track I wrote and recorded in Detroit with Jon Marsh on Drums.

item.itunes:author: Logan Sorese

item.title: Thanks (Cloud Cult cover)
item.description: Woke up with a song in my head, gonna get it out. Cloud Cult got me out of a huge funk this year and I’ve become an evangelist for their music. It’s beautiful and corny and wonderful and everything I want out of a band.
item.content:encoded: Woke up with a song in my head, gonna get it out. Cloud Cult got me out of a huge funk this year and I’ve become an evangelist for their music. It’s beautiful and corny and wonderful and everything I want out of a band.

item.itunes:author: Logan Sorese

item.title: How Odd, How Suspect
item.description: I’ve spent a lot of time this year volunteering with a hospice. It’s an odd gig. Sitting in with people who are dying in the next six months. They know their days are numbered and they have an opportunity to make peace with that. Some do, some don’t, some are...
item.content:encoded:
I’ve spent a lot of time this year volunteering with a hospice. It’s an odd gig. Sitting in with people who are dying in the next six months. They know their days are numbered and they have an opportunity to make peace with that. Some do, some don’t, some are massively depressed, and some act like nothing is different. It’s made me realize that I want to know I’m dying. I don’t want it to be sudden, I want to know it’s name and follow it through.
This song has been brewing for a while and I’m happy with the way it came out. It’s kind of a sleepy one. Enjoy.

They know their days are numbered and they have an opportunity to make peace with that. Some do, some don’t, some are massively depressed, and some act like nothing is different. It’s made me realize that I want to know I’m dying. I don’t want it to be sudden, I want to know it’s name and follow it through.
This song has been brewing for a while and I’m happy with the way it came out. It’s kind of a sleepy one. Enjoy.

item.title: Let Me In
item.description: Ahem. Is this thing on? Welcome to Week #1. This week’s song is called “Let Me In” and I’m trying to not be overly precious about it. I say “try” because I’m fighting an intense urge to go back and edit it right now or re-record vocals or scrap this...
item.content:encoded: Ahem. Is this thing on? Welcome to Week #1. This week’s song is called “Let Me In” and I’m trying to not be overly precious about it. I say “try” because I’m fighting an intense urge to go back and edit it right now or re-record vocals or scrap this entire idea. But that’s exactly why I’m uploading as is.
item.itunes:subtitle: Ahem. Is this thing on? Welcome to Week #1. This week’s song is called “Let Me In” and I’m trying to not be overly precious about it. I say “try” because I’m fighting an intense urge to go back and edit it right now or re-record vocals or scrap this...
item.itunes:summary: Ahem. Is this thing on? Welcome to Week #1. This week’s song is called “Let Me In” and I’m trying to not be overly precious about it. I say “try” because I’m fighting an intense urge to go back and edit it right now or re-record vocals or scrap this entire idea. But that’s exactly why I’m uploading as is.
item.itunes:author: Logan Sorese
